intro: Petrophile canescens, commonly known as the grey-barked rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. This species is typically found in rocky and sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Its woody stems and adaptability to harsh environments make it a resilient component of its native ecosystems.
